intro: Eriogonum aretioides, commonly known as the Arete's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid environments. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces capsules that contain numerous seeds. Eriogonum aretioides is often found in open grasslands and is an important component of its native ecosystem.
